source.author: Ross, J.H.
source.title: Goodia
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Ross, J.H. (1996). Goodia. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Flowers 9–14 mm long; abaxial surface of standard petal and tips of wing petals yellow; lower 3 calyx-lobes usually as long as or longer than the tube and more than 2 mm long, linear-lanceolate; aril attached to the seed by an elongated bifid foot 1.4–2.5 mm long

Flowers 8–10.5 mm long; abaxial surface of standard petal and tips of wing petals purple-brown to reddish orange; lower 3 calyx-lobes usually shorter than the calyx tube, broad-lanceolate to deltoid and less than 2 mm long; aril attached to the seed by a short almost undivided foot up to 1 mm long
Young branchlets, petioles, lower surfaces of leaflets, calyces and pedicels glabrous or sparingly clothed with appressed hairs
Young branchlets, petioles, and lower surfaces of leaflets (and often calyces and pedicels) densely clothed with appressed or spreading hairs
